q: We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars.
h:
“We are all in the gutter, but some of us are looking at the stars. ” —
Oscar Wilde

q: If you set your goals ridiculously high and its a failure, you will fail above everyone elses success.
h:
“If you set your goals ridiculously high and its a failure, you will fail above everyone elses success.” —
James Cameron

q: Big people don't make people feel small.
h:
“Big people don't make people feel small.” —
Robin Sharma

q: Avoiding danger is no safer in the long run than exposure.
h:
“Avoiding danger is no safer in the long run than exposure.” —
Helen Keller

q: Reality is nothing but a collective hunch.
h:
“Reality is nothing but a collective hunch.” —
Lily Tomlin

q: Everyone has oceans to fly, if they have the heart to do it. Is it reckless? Maybe. But what do dreams know of boundaries.
h:
“Everyone has oceans to fly, if they have the heart to do it. Is it reckless? Maybe. But what do dreams know of boundaries.” —
Amelia Earhart

q: Darkness cannot drive out darkness; only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate; only love can do that.
h:
“Darkness cannot drive out darkness; only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate; only love can do that.” —
Martin Luther King, Jr.

q: Numbing the pain for a while will make it worse when you finally feel it.
h:
“Numbing the pain for a while will make it worse when you finally feel it.” —
Albus Dumbledore

q: Live in the sunshine, swim the sea, drink the wild air.
h:
“Live in the sunshine, swim the sea, drink the wild air.” —
Ralph Waldo Emerson

q: Life is a challenge, meet it! Life is a dream, realize it! Life is a game, play it! Life is love, enjoy it!
h:
“Life is a challenge, meet it! Life is a dream, realize it! Life is a game, play it! Life is love, enjoy it!” —
Sathya Sai Baba

q: The less you want, the richer you are. The more you need in order to be happy, the more miserable you'll be.
h:
“The less you want, the richer you are. The more you need in order to be happy, the more miserable you'll be.” —
Yanni

q: Nothing makes a man broad-minded like adversity.
h:
“Nothing makes a man broad-minded like adversity.” —
Will Rogers

q: Living a life that has a greater purpose and living up to it is the ultimate degree that we should strive for.
h:
“Living a life that has a greater purpose and living up to it is the ultimate degree that we should strive for.” —
Gurbaksh Chahal

q: The man who removes a mountain begins by carrying away small stones.
h:
“The man who removes a mountain begins by carrying away small stones.” —
William Faulkner

q: Without the confidence, nothing can be accomplished.
h:
“Without the confidence, nothing can be accomplished.” —
Sathya Sai Baba

q: You can't wait for inspiration. You have to go after it with a club.
h:
“You can't wait for inspiration. You have to go after it with a club. ” —
Jack London

q: Integrity is the ability to stand by an idea.
h:
“Integrity is the ability to stand by an idea.” —
Ayn Rand

q: It matters not who you love, where you love, why you love, when you love or how you love, it matters only that you love.
h:
“It matters not who you love, where you love, why you love, when you love or how you love, it matters only that you love.” —
John Lennon

q: Small men think they are small; great men never know they are great.
h:
“Small men think they are small; great men never know they are great. ” —
Chinese Proverb

q: Dreams are for dreamers. Goals are for achievers.
h:
“Dreams are for dreamers. Goals are for achievers.” —
Arnold Schwarzenegger

q: One beam, no matter how big, cannot support an entire house on its own.
h:
“One beam, no matter how big, cannot support an entire house on its own.” —
Chinese Proverb

q: My mind seems to have become a kind of machine for grinding general laws out of large collections of facts.
h:
“My mind seems to have become a kind of machine for grinding general laws out of large collections of facts.” —
Charles Darwin

q: Thinking is a habit, and like any other habit, it can be changed; it just takes effort and repetition.
h:
“Thinking is a habit, and like any other habit, it can be changed; it just takes effort and repetition.” —
John Eliot

q: I was wise enough to never grow up while fooling most people into believing I had.
h:
“I was wise enough to never grow up while fooling most people into believing I had. ” —
Margaret Mead

q: Things turn out best for the people who make the best of the way things turn out.
h:
“Things turn out best for the people who make the best of the way things turn out.” —
John Wooden

q: Adventure is not outside man; it is within.
h:
“Adventure is not outside man; it is within.” —
George Eliot

q: Numbing the pain for a while will only make it worse when you finally feel it.
h:
“Numbing the pain for a while will only make it worse when you finally feel it.” —
Albus Dumbledore

q: Closing your eyes and listening to silence is self-care.
h:
“Closing your eyes and listening to silence is self-care.” —
Maxime Lagace

q: You will face many defeats in life, but never let yourself be defeated.
h:
“You will face many defeats in life, but never let yourself be defeated.” —
Maya Angelou

q: Everything is created twice, first in the mind and then in reality.
h:
“Everything is created twice, first in the mind and then in reality.” —
Robin Sharma

q: For things to change, you have to change.
h:
“For things to change, you have to change.” —
Jim Rohn

q: Every poem should remind the reader that they are going to die.
h:
“Every poem should remind the reader that they are going to die.” —
Edgar Allan Poe

q: A man who cannot tolerate small misfortunes can never accomplish great things.
h:
“A man who cannot tolerate small misfortunes can never accomplish great things.” —
Chinese Proverb

q: If you don't program yourself, life will program you.
h:
“If you don't program yourself, life will program you.” —
Les Brown

q: I believe that one of life's greatest risks is never daring to risk.
h:
“I believe that one of life's greatest risks is never daring to risk.” —
Oprah Winfrey

q: If you run you stand a chance of losing, but if you don't run you've already lost.
h:
“If you run you stand a chance of losing, but if you don't run you've already lost.” —
Barack Obama

q: Monsters are real, and ghosts are real too. They live inside us, and sometimes, they win.
h:
“Monsters are real, and ghosts are real too. They live inside us, and sometimes, they win.” —
Stephen King

q: Who you are is always right.
h:
“Who you are is always right.” —
Ming-Dao Deng

q: Self-knowledge is the beginning of self-correction.
h:
“Self-knowledge is the beginning of self-correction.” —
Norman Vincent Peale

q: Gratitude is the fairest blossom which springs from the soul.
h:
“Gratitude is the fairest blossom which springs from the soul.” —
Henry Ward Beecher

q: A pessimist is one who makes difficulties of his opportunities and an optimist is one who makes opportunities of his difficulties.
h:
“A pessimist is one who makes difficulties of his opportunities and an optimist is one who makes opportunities of his difficulties.” —
Harry S. Truman

q: I have never let my schooling interfere with my education.
h:
“I have never let my schooling interfere with my education.” —
Mark Twain

q: To create more positive results in your life, replace 'if only' with 'next time'.
h:
“To create more positive results in your life, replace 'if only' with 'next time'.” —
Celestine Chua

q: Death is as sure for that which is born, as birth is for that which is dead. Therefore grieve not for what is inevitable.
h:
“Death is as sure for that which is born, as birth is for that which is dead. Therefore grieve not for what is inevitable.” —
Bhagavad Gita

q: Public opinion is the worst of all opinions.
h:
“Public opinion is the worst of all opinions.” —
Nicolas Chamfort

q: To think is easy. To act is hard. But the hardest thing in the world is to act in accordance with your thinking.
h:
“To think is easy. To act is hard. But the hardest thing in the world is to act in accordance with your thinking.” —
Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

q: I know of only one duty, and that is to love.
h:
“I know of only one duty, and that is to love.” —
George Bernard Shaw

q: Only when you can be extremely pliable and soft can you be extremely hard and strong.
h:
“Only when you can be extremely pliable and soft can you be extremely hard and strong.” —
Zen Proverb

q: How to get more opportunity: Create more opportunity for others.
h:
“How to get more opportunity: Create more opportunity for others.” —
Jack Butcher

q: Success is about doing the right thing, not about doing everything right.
h:
“Success is about doing the right thing, not about doing everything right.” —
Gary Keller
